{"step_by_step_thinking": "The otic ganglion is a parasympathetic ganglion located just below the foramen ovale in the infratemporal fossa. It receives preganglionic parasympathetic fibers from the glossopharyngeal nerve via the lesser petrosal nerve. The facial nerve and trigeminal nerve do not carry preganglionic parasympathetic fibers to the otic ganglion.", "answer_choice": "B. Glossopharyngeal nerve"}
